summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Andrew Tomback and attorney Marc A. Weinstein regarding the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The AUSA is seeking a 2009 deposition transcript of a plaintiff represented by Jack Scarola, where Epstein was represented by Mark Luttier and Bob Critton. Weinstein confirms they have obtained the transcript.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner, Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the SDNY AUSA about locating and confirming possession of a 2009 deposition transcript related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The federal prosecutor from the SDNY who is requesting a specific 2009 deposition transcript from a civil case involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Identified as the attorney who represented the plaintiff in the 2009 deposition that the SDNY is seeking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the SDNY investigation; was represented by specific attorneys in a 2009 civil deposition.

persons.name: Mark Luttier
persons.context: Along with Bob Critton, represented Jeffrey Epstein in the 2009 deposition being discussed.

persons.name: Bob Critton
persons.context: Attorney from Critton, Luttier, and Coleman LLP who, along with Mark Luttier, represented Jeffrey Epstein in the 2009 deposition.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Tomback) is corresponding with private attorney (Weinstein) to obtain a deposition transcript for an investigation.
Mark Luttier, along with Bob Critton, represented Jeffrey Epstein in a 2009 civil deposition.
Bob Critton, along with Mark Luttier, represented Jeffrey Epstein in a 2009 civil deposition.
Partners at Critton, Luttier, and Coleman LLP who jointly represented Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Civil Deposition of Plaintiff
events.description: A deposition took place in a civil case where the plaintiff (name redacted) was represented by Jack Scarola, and Jeffrey Epstein was represented by Mark Luttier and Bob Critton.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Correspondence
events.description: Email exchange between SDNY AUSA Andrew Tomback and attorney Marc Weinstein regarding the procurement of a 2009 deposition transcript for the Epstein investigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was active and seeking evidence as of September 2020.
Prosecutors were specifically seeking a transcript from a 2009 civil deposition where Epstein was represented by attorneys Mark Luttier and Bob Critton.
The plaintiff in that 2009 deposition was represented by attorney Jack Scarola, though the plaintiff's name is redacted in the document.
Attorney Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP successfully located and confirmed possession of the requested deposition transcript for the SDNY.
